article.title: The Formation of S0 Galaxies with Counter-Rotating Neutral and Molecular Hydrogen

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the time evolution of a simulated minor merger. What is being shown in the red regions of each panel?
choices: The stellar component of the primary galaxy
The stellar component of the companion galaxy
The gas component of the primary galaxy
The gas component of the companion galaxy

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure illustrates a method of measuring the radial extent of components in simulated galaxies. What does the horizontal dashed line represent?
choices: The half-mass radius of the gas component
The half-mass radius of the stellar component
The fractional mass value of 0.5
The concentration index of the galaxy

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the distribution and kinematics of components in different merger scenarios (m1-m8). What is the key requirement for producing counter-rotating gas and stellar components in these simulations?
choices: Prograde rotation of the companion galaxy
Prograde rotation of the primary galaxy
Retrograde rotation of the primary galaxy
Equal gas mass fractions in both galaxies

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula describes the density profile of a specific component in the simulated galaxies. Which component does this formula represent?
choices: Dark matter halo
Stellar disk
Gas disk
Bulge

multiple_choice_question.text: This table describes the parameters used in different merger simulations. What does the parameter "fg,p" represent?
choices: The initial bulge mass fraction of a primary galaxy
The initial gas mass ratio of a primary galaxy
The initial gas mass ratio of a companion galaxy
The pericenter distance of a merger in kpc
